meanings.definition: An immoral act considered to be a transgression against divine law.
meanings.sent2: Lying is a sin according to many religions.
meanings.sent3: Eating dessert before dinner may be a sin in some households.
meanings.sent4: Betraying a friend is a sin against trust.
meanings.sent5: In some cultures, not respecting your elders is seen as a grave sin.

meanings.definition: To commit a sin or sins.
meanings.sent1: She sinned by cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: He knows he will sin if he steals.
meanings.sent3: The cat sinned by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The company sinned by polluting the river.
meanings.sent5: They sinned against nature by cutting down the ancient trees.

meanings.sent1: Cheating on a test is a sinful act.
meanings.sent2: Gossiping can be seen as a sinful act.
meanings.sent3: Eating the last cookie without sharing is a sinful act in this house.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring those in need is a sinful act of neglect.
meanings.sent5: Forgetting to say thank you can be a small but impactful sinful act.
